thinking.disposable_income: The IAH Airport area has moderate to low disposable income levels with median household income below Houston's average, as many residents work in airport-related service jobs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have limited discretionary spending capacity and are sensitive to additional taxes and transportation costs given their income levels.
thinking.accessibility: The area is heavily car-dependent due to its suburban location, with limited public transit options despite proximity to the airport, and most residents rely on personal vehicles for commuting.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies with lower sales tax (0.5%) to minimize impact on limited discretionary income 2) Favored moderate driving fees ($0.50) over high fees ($1.00) since most residents are car-dependent 3) Supported lower transit fares ($0.75-$1.25) to make public transit more accessible 4) Balanced travel time improvements with cost burden on residents 5) Selected policies that provide modest transit improvements without excessive financial strain on the community
